Start this process by making a short list of what you don't know.  Now create a list of things that will help you find a solution to the missing pieces of information.

Consider the following example to illustrate this.  Assume that you want to create a web site.  Start by assessing what you know and what you don't know.  Do you need to find a new web host?  Do you need to select a tool for creating the site? Do you need to hire someone to do the work for you?   

Each of these key decisions will have several alternative answers.  Experiment with different solutions until you think that you know enough to make the call.   Once you have made the decision it is time to build the solution.  You are ready to invent!
fields.title: Experiment

fields.body:
One of the best tools for an organization to use is an email auto-responder. An auto-responder is a tool that automatically generates email messages based on certain conditions that you specify. The auto-responder is one of the most underutilized tools available.

This is the tool that evil people use to generate spam that clogs up all of our email in-boxes. The problem of spam (unsolicited email) lies not with the tool but the people using it. Organizations that use an auto-responder properly will be able to greatly improve their communication.

First we will look at how an auto-responder works and then at how you can best use this tool. To program your auto-responder, you set up a sequence of messages that you would like subscribers to receive, configure them to be delivered at predetermined intervals, and then add a subscription form to your web site.

It is very important that people subscribe themselves to your list. This is also called an “opt-in” list. It is one thing to send email that people request; it is entirely different to send people junk that they do not want. It is also important to provide a simple way to unsubscribe with every message.

What makes an auto-responder so powerful is that it moves you from a haphazard communication method to a systematic one. Once you have begun to use this tool, you will realize the convenience of designing a message stream to communicate with new subscribers. Most organizational communication is not thoughtfully crafted. Instead, it is offered as an off-the-cuff response to a query that someone made.

The best way to communicate with a group is to figure out what essential message needs to be communicated and how that message should be sent. Once your messages have been written they are put into the auto-responder and people are invited to subscribe to receive the valuable content that you offer.

Another important aspect of this method of communication is that if your message is not interesting people will unsubscribe. This provides an incentive for you to supply people with information that is practical and valuable to them. In the end, this may well be the biggest advantage of using an auto-responder. It inspires you to tell a more interesting story.
fields.title: Email AutoResponders

fields.body:
When you have identified the goal and the building blocks that you will use to reach the goal you are ready to invent.  It is time to build the solution that will solve your problem.

Every solution has trade-offs.  Taking longer may make the project cheaper.  Doing the work yourself will allow you to invest time instead of money.  Buying a solution that someone else has created will save you time but cost you money.

The essence of invention is figuring out how to match your specific goals with the solution that you create.  To get this right you need a clear sense of what trade-offs you are willing to live with.   A solution that works for you may not be acceptable to someone else.  Create what is right for your situation.
fields.title: Invention

fields.body:
Albert Einstein once said, "Everything should be as simple as possible, but not simpler."  
    Don't do work that isn't needed!    This seems like it should be obvious. Why would we ever do work that isn't really needed? And yet I am amazed at how often I find myself doing tasks for a number of other reasons. One way to break this cycle of ineffective activity is to only perform tasks that have an immediate customer. The person that benefits could be an external client or an internal client (even yourself) that needs you to create something.

    If you only do the minimal work needed to satisfy the “customer” then you will eliminate any gratuitous activities that don't contribute directly to the result. Manufacturing organizations have functioned like this for years. Toyota is an excellent example. On their manufacturing lines they only build a car to satisfy a specific order. Then they only install a dashboard to contribute, which in term generates a request for a speedometer assembly, which creates an order for the required parts.

    It is wasteful to work on tasks that produce results only to find that there is not a clear way to use those results because of other missing pieces in the system. This is where we get the concept of work flow. If you are in the business of publishing any kind of material, then all of the tasks that you perform should be directly supporting the publication that is required. It is important to start with the end in mind and work backwards.

    If the result is clear, then it will be easy to figure out the easiest way to achieve it. What is the minimum set of subtasks that will achieve the desired result? Then what are the subtasks to required to produce those results? This is a more effective way to plan a project to avoid assembling activities that may or may not contribute directly to the end goal.


Try to reduce every solution to its essence.  Inventing something scrutinize it thoroughly to see if half of the remaining parts can be removed.  During the invention process don't worry about the complexity too much. But do not forget this important step before accepting the final solution.

Complexity is the enemy.  If people have to remember to perform a complicated set of steps then it will never happen.   Software automation that requires thousands of lines of code requires a phenomenal investment to keep running.  The best software to debug is one command that does exactly what you want.  The best manual task is the one that requires zero steps for humans to perform.
fields.title: Simplify

fields.body:
Every organization needs to grow and improve. To stop growing means beginning to die. Growth can come in many different forms, but a commitment to learning and improving is absolutely essential. Every business or non-profit organization exists to produce some kind of value for its members, customers, share holders, or those it serves. Growth means producing increasing levels of value over time.

To accomplish this, you must establish practices that are both effective and efficient. Effectiveness is doing the right things so that the desired benefits are actually realized. Efficiency is doing things right to minimize the cost. It is possible for an organization to achieve one of these objectives without the other, but both are necessary to produce the results at a reasonable cost.

In order to constantly improve effectiveness and efficiency an organization must commit to a pattern of constant innovation. It needs to examine what it is doing and how it is doing it. This examination uncovers gaps between what actually is and what should be. Innovation happens when we close this gap.

The first step in creating a cycle of constant innovation is to make a commitment to seeing it through.  Choosing to embark on a journey of continuous improvement means that you will be learning what is needed to take your organization to the next level.

We will be looking at the pieces of the innovation cycle:  Learn, Plan, Invent, and Teach.  This integrated approach will be applied incrementally and continuously to produce the results you need.

In the next few articles I will show you how to create a constant innovation cycle that will allow your organization to continuously grow. By implementing these practices now, you will be able to build upon what you have already accomplished and improve areas of neglect.
fields.title: The Need For Innovation

fields.body:
In the next few articles I will focus on essential technologies that are a "must have" for every organization. If you are missing one of these technologies you will find yourself at a competitive disadvantage. This will continue as long as you try to use an incomplete tool set.

If you don't have a web site yet, this article will give you the information you need to set one up. Fortunately, a great web site can be created and hosted for you with little time or money.

Let's talk about why your organization needs a web site. A web site is an online equivalent to a store front and a yellow pages listing combined. It is the online face of your organization.

Any potential customer or member of your organization will likely visit your web site to understand simple things about your business, such as where you are located and what you are selling. If you are a non-profit group, they will want to know where and when the group meets. They will also expect to see upcoming events and affiliations with other organizations.

A business or organization without a web site may be viewed in the same light as someone doing business out of the back of their van. It may be a completely legitimate organization but the lack of a decent web site undermines credibility.

It is also best, although not absolutely critical, to have your own domain name. You can register a domain name like "MyBusiness.com" for your web site. This will allow people to find you by typing in "MyBusiness.com" into the address field of their browser. The domain name will make your web site look more professional and bring additional credibility to your organization.

Now that you understand why a web site is important, the next article will show you how to set one up quickly and easily.
fields.title: Organizational Web Site

fields.body:
People often ask about the easiest way to create a web site.  The answer is simple:  Let someone else create it for you.  There are a number of different paths to getting an initial web site created.  The resulting websites are very low cost, professional looking, and can be created quickly.  This article details several options for creating a website without any heavy lifting.

The specific tools available to you will depend on the web hosting provider that you select.  Each hosting company will provide either services to build your web site for you or software that can be installed in your hosting account so that you can build the web site for yourself.  If you use a design service to build your site, you will describe the result that you want and they will produce it for you.  This can sometimes produce a dilemma for how to handle the ongoing maintenance of the site.

The other alternative is to install software in your hosting account that has a series of forms to allow you to construct simple web pages, step by step. This method allows you to create a web site by selecting from a series of simple choices.  This is a good way to work if you are unsure about the end result when you start.  The biggest issue with these tools is that you have to know how to create a good web site; they don’t provide the professional advice necessary to create your site.

A third alternative is to find a web hosting provider that creates “managed websites”.  This means that the hosting provider creates the web site, and does ongoing maintenance throughout the life of the site.  With a managed website, you control all of the content on the site.  To get changes made to the site structure you just notify the customer care representative and the changes are made for you.  To update the content on your site you just login and add, modify, or delete articles that appear on your site.

The biggest advantage of this approach over the web design tools is that you do not have to learn about what it takes to create a professional web site. You do not need to learn anything about computer programming or web design; the hosting provider will take care of that for you. Your hosting provider gives you what you need so that you can focus on creating the content that you want to communicate through your site.

Our company, Shrinking World Solutions, provides managed web hosting at prices starting at $60 for a year of service.  The membership price includes all services for creation, hosting, maintenance and support.  This is a great way to get a website running quickly, while allowing for later growth.
fields.title: How to create a website

fields.body:
Did you get it right?  What can break it?  What is the consequence of your system breaking?  When it breaks how will you find out?

These are the questions that you need to ask to assess how well your solution covers the problem that you are trying to solve.  Examine the details of your solution and determine the strengths and weaknesses.  

Make a list of possible future improvements  and the return on the investment that you would expect from each one.  This list will be used for selecting future improvements based on their relative impact.
fields.title: Assessment

fields.body:
If you want to find the area that needs the most improvement, then pain can be great indicator.  Every situation has areas of utter frustration and anguish.  These do not hide;they are in your face each an every day.  This works in our favor if we let it.  We do not have to search to know where the next big improvement needs to happen. It finds us.

Take a minute now to identify the next area that needs work in your life (or the next area of work that needs life).  Phrase the desired outcome that you would like in less than five words.  Examples: "Improve satisfaction scores", "Eliminate unproductive meetings", "TPS reports on-time".

This is an important step in solving the problem. Naming a particular issue give us a certain resolve to improve it.  Think of this as creating an internal commitment to make a difference in the way things work.  This is the first step in making an objective.

Measure the pain in the amount of needless money, time, and stress that is wasted. Attempt to quantify these, so that you can measure any improvements that you make. Your change should bring relief in the area of the greatest pain.  This is also your greatest opportunity.

As you make changes evaluate the impact.  Does the change reduce the pain?   Does it have unexpected side effects?   An honest assessment is essential to achieving the desired results. The actual results of the change should be compared to the expected results.  Did you get the impact that you hoped for?   Or is something blocking the desired result?  Is this problem still worth working on or is there a better opportunity for improvement elsewhere?

The insights that come from this type of evaluation are very useful.  They will help guide your future improvements.
fields.title: Follow the pain

fields.body:
What is the biggest website problem? It may not be what you think.  Many businesses do not have a viable web site, because they cannot update the content themselves. This is the number one reason why websites fail.

An organization knows that they need a website, so they find a web developer to build them a beautiful site.  At the end of the project the site begins aging.  The organization is understandably excited to invite users to their site.  However, on returning a second time, the users find that there is no new information.  They will never return to your site when there are so many others that offer a stream of fresh information updated continuously.

The cure for this disastrous problem is to create a website that is easy for you to update.  With modern tools it can be as easy to update your website as it is to type a document on your computer.  When you see some text that you would like to add or modify, you login and press an edit button.  This gives you an editor that you can cut and paste text into.  The results that you save are instantly viewable from anywhere in the world.

A web site that is easy to change is modified constantly.  Think about a grocery list posted on your refrigerator. Your web site should be that easy for you to change.  If you get a new idea, capture it.  If you have a different way to say something to your users, then correct it before you forget.

These systems that allow you to change the content are often called Content Management Systems (or CMS).  They separate the site structure from the site content. The structure becomes stable very quickly, but the content is updated frequently.  Modifying content is done by publishing articles on the site.

My favorite CMS tool is Joomla. The sites are robust, flexible, easy to maintain, and quick to set up.  Shrinking World Solutions provides services to set up, host the site, and maintain it for the long-term.  This lets you concentrate on publishing the material that your readers want.
fields.title: Biggest website problem

fields.body: Many web sites are meant primarily for displaying information that does not change.  These are extremely simple to build and maintain from a technical perspective.  There are a number of off-the-shelf tools that will help you to create pages with text and images.  They will also create and maintain navigational aids (hyperlinks that let you switch between the pages.)
fields.title: Display web sites

fields.body: Most web sites are created around a database.  This allows the information that is displayed to be dynamic (changed by the users of the site). Adding a database to a web site can be a significant effort but also provide many new features for users.  Data-driven applications are the typical type of web site found on the internet.
fields.title: Data-driven web sites

fields.body: A content management system (or CMS) takes the idea of a data-driven web site to the next level.  It provides a framework that displays content that can be uploaded by using the web site itself.  A CMS contains an administrative interface that lets you author and publish content on the site without ever writing any HTML code.  The user can upload images, document, and create articles dynamically on the site.
fields.title: Content management system

fields.body: There is an excellent selection of hosting services available on the internet today.  These systems are well-managed and extremely inexpensive.  There are few situations where you can justify providing your own hosting capabilities.   Commercial web hosting companies provide hosting for a low as $5 per month.   Consider using on of these services for your next web hosting project.
fields.title: Web hosting

fields.body:
Key questions about communicating vision:
What is the one most important thing that I need to communicate?
Am I clear about the outcome that will be produced?
Is my vision clear and compelling or clouded by uncertainty?
fields.title: Vision

fields.body:
Assess who your audience is:
Do we communicate often enough?
Am I reaching everyone that should be informed?
What do they already understand (or question) about this subject?
fields.title: Audience

fields.body:
Questions to ask about the content of your communication:
Is the message itself clear and compelling?
Is there a clear call to action?
Does the form of the message enhance or detract receptivity?
fields.title: Message

fields.body:
Make sure that your tools and methods are effective:
Do I use a systematic approach to communication to ensure that everyone is informed?
Do I allow for individual learning styles (eg. web sites, meetings, email, webinars, podcasts)?
Are all the forms of communication integrated and coordinated?
fields.title: Tools for communication

fields.body:
Treat communication like any other business process:
How do people respond with feedback and concerns?
How do we measure the effectiveness of the communication?
Is the communication intended to be one-way or two-way and do the tools make this possible?
fields.title: Process of communication

fields.body:
Is is amazing how often people expect others to read their minds.   This can be a dangerous situation when expectations are involved.  It is always important to make sure that everyone holds the same set of expectations.  

One effective way to make sure that expectations are shared is to ask a person to state their expectations.  When you hear someone else describe what you believe should happen, then you are much closer to agreement than when you state your own assumptions and ask for agreement.  

Pay close attention to any nuance that you did not expect to hear.  For example, "That design will be complete on Tuesday, except for the rubilator", is their way of telling you that the rubilator is not included.  On the other hand, if you asked, "Will the design be done next Tuesday?", you would likely not learn this additional information.
fields.title: Expectations

fields.body:
Email is the primary way the people communicate these days.  Your email in-box then becomes your communications queue.  In order to effectively communicate with people, you must process your queue at least once a day.

I recommend that when you process your email in-box that you respond to every message immediately or consciously defer it for later.  You can easily do this by moving it to an action folder within your email software.  These items can them be further organized by priority or subject matter. 

There are many actions that each of us have pending at any point in time.  But these items that require some future action should never cause us to lose track of incoming email.

Any modern email program also has methods for sorting emails into folders as they arrive.    Many emails are simply providing background information and are low priority.  They should be treated as such by the email handling system that you create.  Use the tools that you have at your disposal to make your life easier.
fields.title: Process your inbox

fields.body:
It is amazing how often we have seen the same scenarios play out.  Technologies going head to head, competing for market dominance.  A common theme is, "open vs. closed".

A closed solution is one in which a single vendor controls the product and market.  The company defines the product definition, design, manufacturing, and distribution into the marketplace. Until recent history this was the norm for all products.

In a closed solution competitors attempt to achieve dominance by providing compelling solutions that attract more customers.  Then customers are held captive by continuing to give them more features over time.  The net result is that it becomes increasingly difficult to switch to any other product.  The invested time required to master the current solution becomes a lock-in for these customers.

An open solution by contrast does not have a central vendor that defines the rules.  Instead it relies on using open standards that various competitors can innovate upon.  Open solutions often require complex business models to adapt to the competing interests of different companies.

Ultimately, consumers are the ones that benefit from the increased level of choice.  Rather than accept the single solution that a sole provider offers, the customer can choose from a rich selection of competing alternatives.  Customer are free to choose the best and switch when a better choice comes along.
fields.title: Closed vs. Open

fields.body:
A knowledge system must be critical to the business. If it is an optional part of the work then it will immediately become another thing that people are expected to maintain. There will be a high cost and extremely low benefit. The system must occupy the central role in the work day of each knowledge worker that interacts with it.

The system will become the standard way that people interact with one another. Workers will create and consume information in the system automatically. To help this transition happen requires some very intentional actions. Information must be moved from where it currently is kept into the system and eliminated from old systems. If there are many small repositories that people can draw from then the new system will never become critical and the information will decay to the point of failure.
fields.title: Central to work flow

fields.body:
All of the information in the system must be fresh, complete & accurate data . Information has a natural half-life due to the changes that constantly happen. If the information is not being reviewed and renewed it is falling into decay. Most information has a half-life of around one year. What you wrote last year at this time is only about half true now. Old data is bad data.

A new system being created has another disadvantage. The information will be fairly sparse. People become frustrated by going to the system to look up missing data. If they see the opportunity is this case to create the missing information then the system will thrive. On the other hand, if the view the system as an annoyance then they will blame the system rather than extend it to meet the future need.
fields.title: High-quality data

fields.body:
The psychology and sociology can have a big impact on the system's success. The most fundamental aspect is whether people feel rewarded for using the system. The first milestone, is for people to be rewarded by gathering information from the system. Everyone wants to be more effective at their job. So the best reward is to make the system the most effective way for people to find needed information. Constantly stocking the system with knowledge is the best way to encourage workers to draw from the system.

The next issue is how to encourage users to contribute to the content of the system. First, it must be very easy to do. If there are any hurdles that block this activity it won't happen. Second, people want others to recognize their contributions. There should be an obvious way to assign credit to authors. People want to see their names attached to their work. This also provides an incentive to do high-quality work. Additional recognition for key contributors each month can also significantly increase the level of participation. A $100 bonus for the top contributor can produce amazing motivation within an organization.

The remaining aspect of authorship has to do with editing the work of others. The best system for gathering knowledge provide an easy way to contribute to the work by editing the content that someone else wrote. This creates a group ownership of the end result. Editing content is just as important as authoring the original. This should be recognized by the reward system. This process encourages a healthy interaction between the participants. Collaboration is one of key goals of a knowledge system.
fields.title: Reward system

fields.body:
A knowledge system is most valuable if it integrates many different aspects of the business that were previously isolated. For example, bringing together support activities, troubleshooting, design reference, materials and project management can be a huge cost savings. Not only are many separate systems replaced but new interactions are found between the systems. If done right this can significantly reduce costs while extending the capabilities.

Different pieces of information can be discovered and combined in unique ways. The users of the system are able to navigate through different types of information without paying a penalty for switching contexts or learning a new system.
fields.title: Integration

fields.body:
A significant barrier to system adoption is getting all of the users set up on the new system. It is important to design the appropriate security model of the system from the beginning. Then each user can be mapped into the appropriate roles which in turn governs the permissions that they have to view and modify content.

These users should be set up automatically to use the system, without requiring any action on their part. Later on, as new users are added there should be an easy way to grant them access.
fields.title: Universal secured access

fields.body:
People are naturally skeptical of a new information system being deployed. It is critical to have clear goals for the system. Early on the system must demonstrate that these goals can be achieved. The costs of creating a knowledge system are clearly visible, so the benefits of the system must be made visible right from the start.

This can be done by highlighting each time that the system is used to solve a problem more effectively than the previous way. If there is not an easy way to demonstrate the benefits of the new system quickly then it is best to avoid the project altogether, since it is unlikely to succeed in the long-term. Careful thought should be given to how success can be demonstrated.
fields.title: Demonstrated ROI

fields.body:
Projects need a clear goal and objective. They also need the backing of key leadership within the organization. Building a knowledge system is a long-term commitment that requires a clear mandate from senior leadership.

Obstacles can only be overcome with the clear support of the leaders. They must believe in the goals and objectives of the system. Expectations must be clearly set for the success criteria of the project and the long-term benefits that can be realistically achieved.
fields.title: Executive sponsorship

fields.body: Selecting an operating system is most important computer decision that you will make. There are several good choices that offer different advantages and constraints. Is is best to pick the operating system that best matches the needs that you have.
fields.title: Selecting an operating system

fields.body:
We live a time of unprecedented affluence and longevity.  In America, this has created a typical situation that allows people to live beyond their need for accumulating more.   How much is enough for you?  When you have what you need, what will you do to give your life meaning?  How can you move beyond success to significance.

The book wrestles with these issues and has some fairly radical ideas.  The primary theme is that you will only be fulfilled when you learn how to serve others.  Then the primary question is how to best make a difference with the resources and opportunity that you have.  No easy answers, but some great questions to grapple with.
fields.title: Half Time

fields.body:
Everyone has a super-power. We are are created in such a way that we are predisposed to excel in certain areas. These are our strengths. Unfortunately, the research has shown that the vast majority of people do not operate primarily in there areas of strength. They slog it out day after day in jobs they hate doing things they are no good at.

This book outlines a process for defining your strengths based upon your ingrained talents. Once you are aware of these talents you can fully develop them into strengths. This book is a game-changer for many people.
fields.title: Now, Discover Your Strengths

fields.body:
One common source of stress that all of us face is based on the pressures to take care of the myiad of details that make up our life. This is compounded by not having a system that we can fully trust that reminds us of what needs to be done. David Allen outlines a system that significantly reduces our overall stress by capturing and organizing everything that needs to get done.

This book is a huge benefit to anyone that juggles many priorities at work and home. You can build a simple and personalized system that manages all of your appointments, tasks, reminders, and new information that you want to track. A system replaces trying to remember what needs to happen next.
fields.title: Getting Things Done

fields.body: This book shows you how to use computers to optimize a myriad of daily activities. If is chock-full of great tips and tricks. This is a must read for any computer geek. If you don't like computers then avoid this book. The book contains a lot of tricks that were published in the Life Hacker blog, which is also my favorite blog.
fields.title: Upgrade Your Life

fields.body: This book is a classic on becoming a more effective person. Stephen Covey defined effectiveness as the ability to get things done as well and building relationships. This allows more productive activities in the future. The primary theme is that if you want to become more effective, you must devote energy to working on your character.
fields.title: 7 Habits of Highly Effective People

fields.body:
It is very disheartening to see people start off to make a difference for others and then to lose sight of that initial goal.   Many organizations are set up to serve others only to end up serving only themselves.  Corruption takes a hold quickly but subtlety.

One way to combat this values drift is to intentionally set up explicit goals that limit personal gain.  This serves as a reminder of the original goals.  It provides tension that highlights abuse early so that it can be corrected.
fields.title: Limit personal gain

fields.body:
The primary goal of investing in non-profit work is not for us to feel good.  It is true that there is personal emotional benefit from serving others.  But the ultimate goal of good works is to produce a beneficial result for those being served.

It is time that we think more strategically about doing good.  I admire the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation for this reason.  They not only invest sacrificially to make sure that needs are being met; they also pay careful attention to effectiveness of the programs.

Non-profit organizations are notoriously wasteful.   If the good needing done is worth doing then the stakes are even higher than if it didn't really matter at all.   In other words, if the end is important than the means is also important.

Take a few minutes to ask yourself some hard questions about what you are doing.  Are you maximizing the benefit for the resources that you invest?  Can you optimize how you serve others to make an even bigger impact?
fields.title: Evaluate effectiveness

fields.body:
The primary difference between achieving mediocre results and fantastic ones is the match between strengths and opportunities.  Finding the situation that fits your strengths gives you the opportunity to excel.  Life is too short to waste it by not finding opportunities that are a good fit for you.

Each person has their own "super-power".  Find yours and use it for good.  Everyone will be thankful that you did.
fields.title: Find a good fit

fields.body:
I recently attended the OSCON (open source conference) where Google offered a hands-on development class for the Android phones.  We learned how to write native applications for the phones that have all of the first class integration and polish.  
Another alternative is to write applications that only require a web browser.  These apps will run on any phone with a built-in web browser.  The primary disadvantage is that the application will not make use of all the special features of the phone.
It is also possible to write applications that use an application framework to allow the same application to run on multiple types of phones, such as the Android, iPhone, or Windows Mobile devices.
As part of the development workshop Google gave each of us a Nexus One phone. Now I can start writing my first native mobile device application.
fields.title: Ready to write apps

fields.body:
One of the most powerful applications of a smart phone involves finding information on-the-run.  When you are out somewhere and you need to get directions, look up store hours, or search for a business nearby then a smart phone is for you.  Look up those movie times or find the nearest Starbucks.

All you need is a web browser that fits in you pocket and the ability to connect from anywhere.  Google maps gives you a search tool that let's you find places based on your location.  The link between physical location and web sites is a very powerful, but often overlooked capability.

Here's a scenario to illustrate.  You are visiting another city and are currently at a restaurant. You whip out you phone and look at nearby theaters using google maps. You click on a nearby threatre link to visit the web site.  Here you see the showtimes of the movie you want. You can explore even further if you want to read reviews or watch trailers.  Finally, you get the directions to the theatre.
fields.title: Navigation with a smart phone

fields.body:
A life without passion is not much of a life.  Yet many of us are resigned to trudging instead of prancing through life.  All of us have times of great joy when doing certain activities.  The specific activities differ, but everyone has them.  There is excitement as you anticipate, exhilaration as you participate, and deep satisfaction as you reflect.

These activities are innately life-giving because they are custom suited to you, a perfect match for your personal characteristics.  For some people the perfect day is one spent doing contract negotiation, or fly fishing, or jumping out of airplanes.  For me all of these would be nightmare scenarios.

Certain activities appeal to you because of your unique characteristics.  What you find stimulating will not transfer to someone else because they are not you.  Each person is hard-wired to respond to things in a unique way.  This leads each of us to different passions.

Think of the last time that you were utterly ecstatic to be doing something that you love.  You felt, "This is what I'm made for."  You were thrilled as long as it lasted and sorry to see it end.  You immediately started thinking about the next time.  That is your passion.

There are also times when you feel like you are going through the motions.  There is no joy, no interest, no fun, no passion.  That is no way to be spending your time.  Consider renegotiating these commitments to reduce your involvement.  Shift that time to activities that bring you passion.  Life is too short to be stuck doing what you are not created for.

Think about a subtle change that you could make to your lifestyle to allow more opportunity for your passionate activity.  If you automatically reject this notion because of a sense of duty to others then you are on dangerous ground.  Denying you own internal passions is a sure way to manufacture a crisis.  Instead, understand you passions and find a way to satisfy them while still fulfilling commitments to others.

Think about the next week.  What change could you make to give you an extra opportunity to do your favorite activity?  Can you do your activity as part of other goals?  This is worth putting come creativity into.
fields.title: Pursue your passion

fields.body: Change is a major part of our lives.  How we deal with change governs our effectiveness both on a personal and organizational level.  This book explores the topic of change in depth.  It provides a very simple model to apply to everyday situations that we face.  It present studies and experiences from quite a broad spectrum to illustrate the concepts of change.  It is really easy to read and yet every chapter reveals another great idea that can be applied immediately.   Reading this book significantly increased my understanding of the process of change.  This understanding can be applied both personally and professionally.
fields.title: Switch

fields.body:
There are some things that you do many times every day, and these tasks govern your effectiveness.  These are either tasks that consume a large chunk of your time, ones that you do many times throughout the day, or tasks that will cause you great remorse if neglected.
These task (taken together) are your essential tasks.  How you deal with these will largely determine your personal effectiveness.  It may help to highlight a few essential tasks in each of the three categories.
I am a consultant so each month invoices must be created.  This is not a complicated task but it can be time-consuming.  Because this is recurring and costly it is an essential task for me.  Instead of spending time just creating the invoice I try to invest the same amount of time improving the way that I create an invoice.
If it takes me a thirty minutes to create an invoice then it would be better to invest thirty minutes today to let me create an invoice next time in fifteen minutes.  
The rule of thumb is that if you have a recurring job that takes X to do then invest X in trying to get the job to cost X/2.  On your second time you will break even.  In our example, it took 60 minutes (30+30) to create three invoices the old way, and now it takes 60 minutes (30+15+15).  If you do 24 invoices a year you save 5 1/2 hours (15m*24-30m). 
You save the most by improving the tasks that take the largest percentage of your time.  In our invoicing example we were dealing with a task that takes 12 hours in a year.  Consider a task that consumes 40% of your work time.  Now you're talking about a whopping 800 hours every year.   If you could find a way to improve this essential task by 50% then you could save 400 hours every year. 
I recommend that you use this type of a simple calculation with your most essential tasks.  These are the ones that when gathered represent the bulk of your time investment.  In the previous example if you could get a gain of 400 hours in a year then it would be worth investing up to 400 hours to achieve it.  Remember that time invested in improving continues to pay you back.
fields.title: Optimize Essential Tasks

fields.body:
In ancient Greece the citizens would gather in the marketplace to share ideas.  Each person would have opportunities to discuss the key topics of the day.  New ideas would emerge from this forum that would change the nature of the society that then lived in.
Today's technology allow for a resurrected version of the idea forum.  Using online tools people can gather with others that share a common interest.  Ideas can be exchange and developed.
One idea stimulates another.  Just hearing what someone else thinks about a subject invokes a response.  A new idea is built on the old one and true value is created.  Without the interaction ideas do not evolve nearly as fast.
Participating in an idea forum can be facinating; the interaction is exhillarating.  The forum provides a robust context for discussion and also the means to keep it going.
Come join us as we share out best thoughts with each other.  Browse a few articles and consider writing your own thoughts down.  Submit your ideas to Shrinking World Guide.  Our editors will select the best for publication.
fields.title: The Idea Forum

fields.body:
Tablet computers have been around for a while. But now we are seeing exciting new introductions in this product category.  To understand the new devices is it necessary to contrast them with the more traditional offerings.
In past years Microsoft has been the primary player in this product category.   It developed a lot of functionality for what it was calling Tablet PC.  These would typically come as a laptop with a swivel on the computer screen.  You could either use the computer as a normal laptop or in a table configuration.  The screen would pivot around and then lay down over the keyboard with the tablet surface facing up. 
These devices were really laptops in almost every respect.  They had the same advantages and disadvantages.  They ran Microsoft Windows which is a 'pro' for many and a 'con' for others.  I used a tablet PC as my primary computer for a couple of years.
The advantage of the design over a standard laptop was that you could take it with you and conveniently use it in meetings to take notes.  The handwriting recognition was an interesting toy, but not a lot of utility.  The primary use of a tablet is that it was more convenient for reading.  It is easy to sit on a couch and browse the internet with a stylus instead of a mouse.  This same advantage is preserved by the modern tablets.
fields.title: Tablet PCs

fields.body:
The iPad is more of an appliance than it is a computer.  It is a special purpose device that is extremely well suited to certain tasks, while being lousy at everything else.  
A computer tends to be pretty useful across a broad range of tasks.  The operating system in a computer allows the same tool to be used in a variety of ways.  For example, I would expect my computer to balance my bank account, browse the internet, call up other computers, backup my files, and a long list of other tasks.  The down-side of having a tool that does everything is that it is difficult to setup and keep in good working order.  It is complicated to use as well.  Each application has a large number of options and requires significant time to learn to use it properly.
An appliance, on the other hand, tends to do one thing well.  A great appliance does one thing extremely well.  For me, the iPad is a perfect reading appliance.  When I want to read something I pick up the iPad and push the "on" button.  It hops to life instantly and the next action is to select what I wish to read.  No fumbling through menus or getting side-tracked to "work" on my computer.
Because of the closed nature of the iPad it is not useful to me at all as a general purpose computer.  This is precisely the value of the iPad to me.  It doesn't try to be a computer.  It is simply a reading appliance.  And that is a great thing.  I spend hours everyday reading so it is wonderful to have an appliance that is perfect for the task.
fields.title: The iPad is not a computer

fields.body:
MyBook is an electronic publishing format that allows you to author and publish your content on the internet. Readers can either browse the content interactively on the web or download the entire book for off-line reading, when you don't have an active internet connection.

Authors can create the material online and download a copy of the data file to their local computer for safe keeping. You own the content file that is displayed on your My Book site.  You can move from creating content to instant publishing.

As a publisher you can create your own site which is hosted at My Book Online.org. You can also download the software and use it to set up your own host environment.
fields.title: About My Book Online

fields.body: The readers of "MyBook" can read the content online from the web site. They can also download the book in HTML or PDF format for offline reading. Both of these capabilities are part of the reader experience.
fields.title: MyBook for the Reader

fields.body:
To read MyBook all you need is an internet connection and a web browser. A perfect device for reading is a low cost netbook or a iPad.

The content of the book is organized as a series of topics. Each topic is nested under related topics to provide more details. When displaying a page of topics the text from the topics one level down is also displayed. This allows you to read while getting a slightly more complete context without clicking to go deeper. This sneak-peek feature is one of the innovations in usability unique to MyBook.

An index will get you to each of the topics in the book quickly. The index page shows you all of the topics of the first three levels of the book. This lets you scan the entire book looking for interesting topics. It encourages you to skim rather than read the whole book. People are busy and they are looking for value quickly. In this internet age we are all looking for instant gratification.

Each page of the site has links to help you get back to where you came from. Click on any of these link to go up in the topic list. This gives you an extremely fast way to jump through the topics of interests. It lets your readers catch the ideas that they are interested in without having to wade through the rest.
fields.title: Online reading

fields.body:
The content of MyBook can be downloaded in HTML format. This single file can be used on any computer. It is very portable to any web browser and compatible with any operating system.

You can easily import HTML into a word processor (such as Microsoft Word). This can be useful for working with the content in a way other than how it was originally published.
fields.title: Download MyBook

fields.body:
Each MyBook can be searched to find keywords. This makes it a perfect format for reference materials. You can quickly jump to the topics that you need and bypass the labor of thumbing through many pages of material looking for the needle in your haystack.

Currently the browsers search capability is used to find the content that you are interested in. The best way to search is to go to the "Entire book" page. This creates an HTML page that shows all of the content for the book.

Next you use the "Ctrl-F" key to let you set the phrase to search for. You can use the "Next" button to select other matches. Once you find the topic in the "Entire book" page you can use the links of the topic titles to go the topic display for that page. This lets you find other topics that are connected to this one.
fields.title: Searching MyBook

fields.body:
MyBook contains all the tools that you need for creating the content for your book online. This chapter will step you through how to write articles and modify them later.

Also in this chapter you will learn how to connect the individual topic together so that the reader will have an easy time navigating through them.
fields.title: MyBook for the Author

fields.body:
To create a new topic select "Write" in the top menu. Enter the information that you wish to add.

Use the "Parent" selector to establish the reading order for this topic. Select the parent topic that this one is a subtopic for.

That's it. Now you've added your first article.
fields.title: Write a new article

fields.body: To modify an existing topic just select "Edit topic" from the bottom menu. Change the content and hit "Save Topic". This will save the changes back in the database on the web site. Now everyone will see the changed topic.
fields.title: Modify an Existing Topic

fields.body: The order that the topics are presented to the user is determined by the nesting of the topics. All topics are arranged in a hierarchy. Each topic has a single parent. You can select this parent anytime you are editing a topic.
fields.title: Change the Reading Order

fields.body:
Occasionally you will need to delete a topic that has been created. When a topic is deleted all of the references to that topic are automatically removed for you.

There are two ways to delete a topic. You can select "Change Topics" from the bottom menu and then select the topic that you wish to delete. In the edit view you will see a delete option at the bottom of the screen.

In order to delete multiple topics at once you can go to the "Change Topics" screen and click on the check boxes for the topics you want to delete. Then select the "Delete items" from the Action list.
fields.title: Delete a topic

fields.body:
Publishing involves the administration of the site, authors, and content. As a publisher you can create a new site to be used to display your online book. Creating a new book means that you create a place for the book on the server and create a database that holds all of your content. It also displays the content of your book using a web address (know as a URL) that is unique to your book.

Sometimes you will want to delete topic completely from the database. Note that this is different than deleting the text within a topic. MyBook provides tools for deleting the records that hold topics that you no longer want. Go to the "Change topics" link in the authoring tools to remove unwanted topics.

As a publisher you can grant permission to other authors. This allows them to collaborate with you on a MyBook project. It is a great way to jointly develop an online book together.

As a publisher you can download a copy of the entire web site as a data file. This gives you an electronic form of the book in a single file. You can backup your copy of the book and restore it later if you wish. This gives you full control over your MyBook content. The web site is then nothing more than a display vehicle for your content.
fields.title: MyBook for the Publisher

fields.body:
MyBook is a tool that can be used to publish any online content. There are MyBook Hosting Services available that will provide a complete host environment for the MyBook content.

Another option is for you to set up your own MyBook Hosting. MyBook is available in source code for so that you can install all of the software that you need to run your MyBook application.

MyBookOnline.org is a web site that hosts the open source project. The MyBook server is available to anyone that needs it under the Gnu Software License.
fields.title: MyBook Hosting

fields.body: MyBook is an open source project that is dedicated to making it easy for everyone to publish books online. We believe that many people have something meaningful to say and that tools should be readily available without requiring advanced technical training.
fields.title: MyBook for the Developer

fields.body: This chapter covers the MyBook functionality from the software developer's perspective. MyBookOnline.org is a web site that hosts an open source project. The MyBook server is available to anyone that needs it under the Gnu Software License.
fields.title: Developer notes

fields.body:
There are several key technologies that are used to build MyBook. Each of the unique technologies work together to bring a stable foundation for the MyBook platform. Any of these technologies may be replaced by another that provides improved characteristics. This chapter outline the current technology stack that is used today.

Django
The most important technology decision for MyBook is the selection of the Django web application framework. Django is perfect for these types of applications. It is easy to write shell scripts that write the custom code for the application.

Django is very flexible in allowing custom code where it is needed while eliminating any repeated code structures that are common within web applications. In other words it is easy to write a simple program that does nothing and then grow it into a powerful application by incrementally adding features.

Python
The Django application framework is written mostly in the Python programming language. Python is a very concise and powerful language. Programmers familiar with Python are much more productive than programmers using other languages. There is excellent support for both high and low-level language features.

Python also enjoys some of the fastest execution times for scripting languages. It is extremely portable and can run across many computer architectures and operating systems.

MySql
The MyBook application saves its data in a MySQL database. MySQL is an open-sourced implementation of the Structured Query Language (SQL) that drives most databases in use today. It is available free of charge. It is free to use in any way that you see fit.

Overall it is the leading choice of developers looking for an alternative to the proprietary solutions provided by large vendors. This issue of vendor lock-in can be a significant millstone around the neck of any project.
fields.title: Technology

fields.body:
An application is a collection of features that are interconnected to support the desired user experience. Each group of related features provides certain capabilities for the user. The scenarios that are implemented are called "user stories". These stories describe the task that can be performed by the application.

This project is intended to be immediately useful in its most embryonic form. Many projects are only useful when they have been fully completed. MyBook is organized and driven by having an initial core functionality that is improved over time.

Each step of the evolution will only make it better. This also means that the application itself is constantly under construction. New features are not added to the application until they work correctly.

This gives you a stable and reliable platform that you can use that will continue to get better over time.
fields.title: Building user stories

fields.body:
This project is directed by a wish list of things we want to see implemented. These user stories not yet implemented, but we intend to implement them as quickly as possible.

If you have interest in working on one of these features then read the Get involved section to see how.
fields.title: Feature wish list

fields.body:
The reader can download an HTML or PDF file that contains the entire content of the book. This is very convenient for offline reading.

Each topic contains references to other web sites. This is a powerful way to provide links to additional information that is not contained directly within the book.

An index of all the topics can be seen through the Table of Contents. This lets the reader jump very quickly to any topic from a single page. It also helps the reader to understand the overall content of the book.
fields.title: Reader User Stories

fields.body:
The writing features are protected by a password. The author must be logged in to edit any of the online content.

There is a view that allows the order of all the topics to be modified. It is a customized version of the table of contents. The current topic can be moved up and down in the reading order. The effect of this operation is to change the which topic is considered the parent of the topic in question.
fields.title: Writer User Stories

fields.body: There is a view that allows new publishers to provide their profile. Then a new web site is created using their information. This site can be created with no manual intervention.
fields.title: Publisher User Stories

fields.body:
There are several distinct goals for this project. Each of these goals is important for the success of the project.

* deliver a great online reading experience.

* download an eBook for offline reading.

* allow anyone to use the software any way they choose.

* provide convenient way for authors to create published material online.

* protect the content with secure access and backup of data..

* invites collaboration from other programmers.
fields.title: Project Goals

fields.body:
MyBook is an open-source project that gives you the ability to read, write, and publish. We believe that everyone should be able to do this free of charge. We also believe that the software that allows this should be given away for other people to build on.

If you believe in this goal then work with us to build something of value to help everyone. We have immediate needs for three main types of contributors. First, we need programmers to help build the wish list. Second, we need marketing people to help build and promote the brand "MyBook". Third, we need people that can write to help add instructions and supply feedback while they use the software.

If you want to help us build MyBookOnline.org then contact Mark Seaman at http://MarkSeaman.org. Mark is the founder of this project and is currently coordinating the efforts of others.
fields.title: Get Involved

fields.body: markseaman.html
fields.title: Mark Seaman

fields.body:
Traditionally, computers have been so expensive that you used the one that you had for everything.  This is no longer the case.  Now computers are both cheap and highly specialized.  Computer devices are available that are a perfect fit for specific tasks that you do. You should consider the advantages of using specific computers for specific tasks.

I use five different computers on  a daily basis. This is a model for how you could set up your system as well.  Here is a breakdown of the computers and when they get used.

Desktop
This computer stays in my office and is used when I will be spending several hours working.

Laptop
When I work off-site but still need to work in speed and comfort then this is the computer that I choose.

Netbook
This is my favorite choice for writing.  I can sit on my couch or back desk and still have a real keyboard.  This is also the best choice for travel where the work is not the main purpose for the travel.  It is a real computer so it is possible to do work, but it is also extremely portable.

iPad
This is my primary reading device.  I don't want to sit in front of a computer for hours to read a book.  My iPad is the perfect mobile reading platform, either and home or mobile.

Android phone
A smart phone is the perfect device for carrying around an internet connection in my pocket.   Where ever I am ready to lookup information or use the GPS to locate businesses.   This is my quick lookup device of choice.

None of these devices really overlap that much.  They each serve a purpose that is excellent in an area, but frustrating once they move outside of their area.
fields.title: Match the device to the task

fields.body: Shrinking World Guides provide tips about how to thrive in the modern world.  They cover issues of Technology, Leadership, and Personal Effectiveness.
fields.title: Author

fields.body: Mark has worked on over fifty successful software projects. He has developed an understanding of what makes projects work and how they fail. He is able to work with a software development team to produce high quality software, that is delivered for the lowest cost, and meets the business goals. They key is using techniques that make the team more agile and focus on the most important priorities of the project.
fields.title: Project management

fields.body: Mark is an expert in taking a complex (and often messy) system and making it simpler. There are usually key ideas and concepts within a system that allow it to be restructured. At the same time a test strategy must be created to improve the testability of the legacy system. This gurantees that the system refactored while preserving its integrity.
fields.title: Architecture

fields.body: Many software projects start without clear goals about. Business changes and a growing understanding of the problem must be incorporated into the project plans. Mark uses an approach that works closely with clients to clearly understand the problem by showing them specific solutions to individual problems. This guides the development process and creates constant feedback. It also guarantees that the most important features are implemented first.
fields.title: Requirements

fields.body:
Mark has been granted 11 US Patents so far, and filed for another 11.

Mark has created commercial software on a wide variety of products including:
* Digital camerts
*		Scanners
*		Printers
*		Disk drives
*		OCR (Optical Character Recognition)
*		Industrial control system
*		Computer automation
*		Distributed computing
*		Digital imaging
* Software development tools
fields.title: Inventor

fields.body: Mark is fascinated by the process of creating low-cost, high-quality software.  He has spent a lifetime figure out how to do it more efficiently.
fields.title: Software developer

fields.body:
Mark is the founder and owner of a software consulting company which provides the following core products:
*	Software development services
*	Data driven web sites
*	Software development process improvement	
*	My Book Online
fields.title: Shrinking World Solutions

fields.body: This guide gives tips to help people learn how to use technology to solve problems that they face in their everyday lives. The pace of change that we all face has created an enormous burden of choice. The Technology Guide is your source to give advise on what to pursue and what to avoid.
fields.title: Technology Guide

fields.body: Most of us wish to have more influence on those around us. The Leadership Guide will give you practical advice on how to build and lead a team of people where you do not have any direct control. Leadership is an essential part of our modern lives.
fields.title: Leadership Guide

fields.body: How do we become more effective in our personal and professional lives? This is the subject of the Personal Effectiveness Guide. Discover the secrets to having a low-stress life while succeeding in a high-stress world.
fields.title: Personal Effectiveness Guide

fields.body: If you are an author, My Book Online will help you reach your goals faster. It is a tool for online publishing that helps you create material online. It also allows your readers to read your book offline or interactively online. When you book is finished you can sell it through Amazon Kindle store online. This guide describes how to use My Book Online to create and distribute your book.
fields.title: My Book Online

fields.body:
Mark is proficient in a large number of programming languages, frameworks, and tools platforms. He is an expert in C++, C#. He has written around one million lines of code in his carreer, choosing to focus on real implementation rathers than creating Power Point slides. His greatest joy is to turn on something cool and see it work properly.

Mark believes in software craftsmanship and involved with other agile software practioners to help raise the bar in software development. Better software practices can lower the development cost and increase the results delivered by any software team. It is worth spending time and effort to achieve this goal.
fields.title: Programming

fields.body: Mark is a tool guy. He believes that problems that must be solved many times require an automatic solution. Why reinvest in learning how to do a series of step, only to have to relearn them the next time. Instead, invest the same energy creating a solution that can be applied anytime you wish. Mark brings a unique blend of real-world pragmatism and technical knowledge to each of these tools situations.
fields.title: Tools & process

fields.body:
The most important aspect of light-weight planning is that it is easily updated. Plans that require twenty hours of painful deliberation will always far outlive their usefulness.  It must be easy for you to make minor adjustments as you learn new information.

If your plan can be adjusted in five minutes then you will not hesitate to do so whenever it is needed.  The most crucial planning involves identifying the top five risks and the best action to lower the risk.  Therefore a minimalistic plan is just a list of those risks and the actions that will address them.

Adjusting this plan can certainly be done in five minutes.  You can write this on a list in your pocket and review it as you wait in line. This is portable, flexibile, and yet robust enough to encourage disciplined thinking.

As things change you can easily switch priorities on your top five risks.  It is equally easy to decide on a different action for one of the risks.  As new risks are discovered you can integrate them onto your list.  Remember to prioritize the list to actively track your top five.  Otherwise you will end up with a list of twenty things which is the same as having no priority at all.

How often should the plan be update?  Whenever you have new information or new ideas then update your plan.  Each time you are ready to make a different decision then update your plan and think about all of the implications involved.

Consider these changes as adjustments, rather than create a new plan.  You are refining your thinking based on your best knowledge at the time.  Don't lock yourself into old ideas that no longer are optimal.  The changes are minor tweaks in a consistent overall direction.

By making small but constant changes you are always ready to respond to the next change in your project.  No longer are you locked in to obsolete plans that have no chance of success.  Instead you have a consistent path forward with an infinite variety of possible paths.
fields.title: Update your plan

fields.body:
MyBook is set up to let you host your own web site.  You need to find an internet service provider (or ISP) to setup an account that allows you shell access.  Then download the software for MyBook onto your computer.  Once the software is working properly on your local computer you will transfer it to your ISP account.

In order to get this working properly you should be familiar with the following technologies:
* Linux command line
* Python
* MySQL
* Django
* Apache 

This is a good project for a computer hobbyist that enjoys a challenging computer project and views the experience as a learning opportunity.  This is definitely not the best hosting alternative to use if you are not familiar with each of the prerequisite technologies.
fields.title: Self hosting

fields.body:
Learning is too important to be left to chance.  What you learn will dictate the opportunities that you have. You need a plan for learning and a system that allows you to track your progress.  By following a few simple practices you can put your learning into overdrive.

A learning system should be goal oriented.  At its core you should have tools for setting and tracking learning goals.  There are several different time horizons that you will want to work with.  You should be activity thinking about what you wish to learn in the next year, the next month, and the next week.

Your system should be simple.  Start with a simple text file.  Any more complicated tool tempts you to focus on the format of the information rather than the information itself.  I speak from experience here, having used many different tools like mind-mapping, outliners, word processors and goal setting tools.

Short is better than long. One page is more than enough to capture any set of goals that you have.  A small amount of planning is productive, but more planning is not.  Your plan should be just comprehensive enough to give you confidence that you are working on the right things.  Any more than that is a waste.

Start with your short term.  What are you learning this week?  Make a list of the things that you are actively learning.  Now group these into goals for the next month.  Are there other things that you need to learn this month that are not on this list?

Now focus on the long term.  What  would you like to be learning over the next year?  As you do this level make sure to reconcile what you are doing now with where you would like to be in a year.  When you are done you will have a complete map of where you want to be in a year and how your daily activities can contribute to that.

The first time that you go through this process you could easily spend an hour or two.  Once you have your initial plan it should take no more than five minutes to review the plan and make any minor corrections due to what has changed.  You should review this plan at least once a week.

There you have it: a simple but robust system to manage your learning, that takes one piece of paper and five minutes per week.
fields.title: Your Learning System

fields.body:
When it comes to changing habits, small consistent changes are far better than large ones.  The reason is simple.  A large change is almost always temporary while a small one is sustainable.

Rather than trying to change everything thing at once, consider embracing an attitude of sustainable change.  Adopt a mindset of analysis and constantly apply minor improvements.  Apply changes one at a time.

Any change that you apply should be sustainable for the rest of your life.  Consider carefully one minor tweak and then fully adopt it into your life before you choose the next one.  Build incrementally on what is already effective in your life.

You will need to develop four essential competencies. These are the abilities to Learn, Plan, Invent, and Teach. In this series of articles you will learn to apply these capabilities to build a system of constant innovation for your organization.

The whole process of innovation begins with Learning. This includes the ability to analyze the problem, understand all the key constraints, and identify possible solutions. In future articles we will explore each of these key aspects in detail. For now, think about a problem area that you need to improve. Jot down a few ideas related to these three aspects: Analysis, Constraints, and Solutions.

Now we are ready to proceed to the Planning stage. The three phases of planning are: establish objectives, prioritize the possible solutions, and breakdown the specific tasks for the projects that you intend to implement. The objectives you set will help you to do the cost-benefit analysis that is needed to prioritize between alternatives. The tactical planning is usually the simplest planning step.

The Inventing stage is when you apply the solution you created and measure the results. It is critical to set up the change as a controlled experiment to confirm what you thought would happen. These changes should always be applied incrementally to guarantee that you are producing the desired result from your change. Implement only one change at a time, and reject changes that do not produce the benefit that you expected.

Teaching is about standardizing the result. You should create a new script for the improved process. This change must be communicated to everyone that is affected by it. This won’t happen automatically. The change should also be applied in a slightly different context to see if it holds up well there too.

This all sounds very simple, and it actually is. The process of improvement is very straightforward. Most people don’t do it because thinking through each of these steps can be difficult. Having a structure makes it easier to progress through each of the steps and achieve the results that you need. Try this on one nasty problem and see if you agree.

Improvement is about change and looking critically at what works and what doesn't. It may require breaking new ground and trying something that no one has ever tried. But it may also be adopting a best practice that you have seen applied in a different context. Driving improvement takes a certain mindset. It requires that we ask, “How can this be better?”, “What would I really like from this process?”. It requires an attitude of optimism and the ability to see the potential beyond the current reality.

An innovative mindset will help you to overcome the inevitable resistance that you will encounter as you begin to change things. Think about what must change in your environment. What things could use improvement? What would bring you the greatest benefit? What would be best case scenario look like? What obstacles must be overcome to get to that new potential? These are the questions that a true innovator asks.

The clarity of the answers will allow you to share your vision of the new future with those around you. Great changes always involve others. By having a firm understanding of where you need to go, you can build a team of people to help you get there.

Begin looking at your life through the eyes of possibility. What would the ideal look like? You may not be that far off. Use the 80/20 rule, which says that 20% of the effort may get you 80% of the desired benefit. In other words, focus on a few high-impact areas for improvement, rather than trying to change everything. Pick the single largest improvement and create a different there.
fields.title: Make constant improvements
